dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: On complete darkness. A SMALL DOOR swings open. A circle of light reveals that we I re looking down the  length of a tube. At the far end of the tube, we see a  gloved hand dangling a rat. The hand shoves the  frightened rat into the tube and closes the door behind  it. The rat s stark white fur bristles and it begins to  pad down the tube s length. After several feet, the tube opens up into a dimly lit  cubicle. The rat hesitates and stops. The SOUNDS of gentle BREATHING whispers in the rat s  ears. The rat turns round to head back down the tube, but a  door swings shut, trapping it in the cubicle. The rat cowers as the BREATHING turns to SNORTING. The rat s head jerks around, looking for signs of danger, but the cubicle is empty. The rat sees a water dish on  the far side of the cubicle - a place to hide - and  dashes toward it. But an invisible force descends. The rat squeals in agony as something smashes down on its body, crushing it. A LOUD BELLOW rings out, and the rat flies into the air,  halting a few feet off the ground. Its body writhes,  struggling against the unholy force. Then a sick crunch of tiny bones snapping. All life  quickly drains from the levitating body. Dead eyes... The creature s corpse floats in mid-air. Then the white  fur of the rat explodes in a shower of blood. HUGE BLOOD SMEARED INCISORS appear, as do the red-slicked ape- like lips. The gaping bloody mouth bites again into  the rat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background we hear Jay Leno s monologue from the  Tonight Show. A small lamp and the glow from a computer  screen illuminates SEBASTIAN CAINE, late twenties with  the shabby good looks of a perpetual grad-student. Wiry  framed and wearing only boxer shorts, Sebastian sips  coffee from an  Einstein  coffee mug. He peers at a  complex computer rendered molecule displayed on his  screen. He pecks a few keys and the molecule shifts  slightly, then falls apart. Sebastian pulls a twinkie from a hostess box, unwraps the cellophane and sucks it down. He attacks the keyboard  with renewed vigor. Another molecule appears on the screen. Sebastian s  fingers fly across the keyboard. The molecule blinks on  and off, it trembles and twists apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damnit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian pears out his window. Across the courtyard, a  light comes on in a neighboring window. He sees a  BRUNETTE, mid-twenties, absolutely stunning, enter her  living room. The Brunette thumbs through the mail, tosses it and then begins to undress. Sebastian loans over to  the window, getting interested. But when the brunette  reaches her bra and panties, she crosses to the window  and lowers her shades. SEBASTIAN (cont d) Damnit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian leans back in his chair and closes his eyes.  He s obviously tired. He opens his eyes and stares up at  the ceiling. Painted across the white matte finish in big red letters is a brief reminder -  You Should Be  Working.  Sebastian sighs, leans forward and begins  pecking away again.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The television is now only static. We pan by his alarm  clock. 4 am. We find Sebastian pacing in front of his  computer. He gets an idea... slides back in his chair. Types away  again. The molecule reforms on the computer screen. He types a few more keys, waits, watches the molecule.  Nothing happens. He hits a few more keys and watches intently for a  reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) I am a goddamn genius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits a few more keys and a telephone keypad appears on the screen. He dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Digital phone rings. In the bed, LINDA FOSTER, late twenties, stirs from a  deep sleep. As she straggles out of bed and over to her  desk, we notice a young man sleeping next to her. The ringing continues. She moves her computer mouse  around and her screen comes to life. She click on a  telephone icon and the ringing stops. A beat later,  Sebastian appears in a window on her screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian, do you know what time it  is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Da Vinci never slept. Said it  was waste of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian peers at the image of Linda in the computer  window. He notices something behind her in the bed, the  young man sleeping face down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who s that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda pulls the camera off the top of the of the computer screen and positions it so Sebastian can t see the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not your business. Not anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Touche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you calling about anything in  particular, or were you just hoping to  catch me sleeping in the nude?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cracked the reversion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upon hearing this, Linda receives a jolt of adrenaline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cracked it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian hits a couple of keys. A moment later the  molecular structure appears on Linda s computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 91% sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (astonished) Eleven months with no progress and you  suddenly come up with it out of the  blue? How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The usual. Coffee and twinkies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. You think you could hunt down  Matt and get to the lab early. I want  Isabelle prepped for a live test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think I can find him. What are  you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well y know. It s daylight in  Switzerland. I gotta call the Nobel Committee and tell them to get our prizes ready. See you in a few.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON LINDA S COMPUTER SCREEN as Sebastian clicks off. Linda crosses to her bed, and shakes the guy awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. MATTHEW KENSINGTON, late 20s too, stirs from under  sheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groggy) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian just called. We gotta get to  the lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt bolts up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! You didn t tell him I was here,  did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me some credit, will ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what s the rush?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cracked reversion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt pulls his jeans on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna ride down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We better take our own cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You re gonna have to tell him about us  eventually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. It s just You re his best  friend. He ll feel betrayed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a distance, the Nation s Monuments stand awash in  the harsh light of morning. CAMERA finds a BLACK PORSCHE as it pulls to the security  fence of a warehouse. The imposing structure is  surrounded by a chainlink fence and barbed wire. The Porsche is waved through security and heads straight  into the warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Porsche pulls to a halt in a reserved parking space  and Sebastian exits, wearing a Hawaiian shirt, shorts,  and Birkenstocks. He notes the other cars parked in the  lot, then crosses to bunker in the center of the  warehouse, guarded by a MARINE, shouldering an M-16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your team s in early. Something  special going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Ed. You know the rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian presses his thumb against a glass screen. A  laser reads his print.  Scan readout: CAINE, SEBASTIAN  Clearance:    ALPHA ALPHA THREE  Division:        CLASSIFIED  The doors whisk open and Sebastian steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a good day, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the elevator is a numberless keypad. Sebastian  taps in his floor code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Authorization please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caine zero zero two seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Authorization verified. Good morning,  Dr. Caine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator descends with a groaning hum. It passes  below us and keeps descending into the belly of the  earth, the shaft goes down forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We slowly push down a hallway panelled by Plexiglas  chambers. Each chamber looks as if it s tailored for a  specific animal, although no animals are visible. As we pass one habitat, something slams into the  Plexiglas and begins barking. Another HOWL joins in. Then SCREECHING. Suddenly the hallway fills with a dozen  animal cries. THUMP. THUMP. The Plexiglas on several chambers vibrates as if angry  animals were slamming against it. But still, no animals  are seen. Above each chamber, VIDEO SCREENS display THERMAL IMAGES  revealing heat signatures of the various animals, but  they remain invisible to the naked eye. MATT taps on a  sheet of Plexiglas which seals off another seemingly  empty cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabelle ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woodchips on the floor shift and suddenly the  Plexiglas steams up right in front of Matt s face. The  Plexiglas begins to shake violently. MATT (cont d) Calm down baby. Calm down. It s  okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt takes a pair of thermal goggles from his belt and  pulls them down over his eyes.  THERMAL POV - A rather large heat signature, ape-like in  shape, rattles about the cage. Matt slowly unlatches the  Plexiglas door and reaches inside. MATT (cont d) It s okay, baby. It s okay. I m not  going to hurt you. Come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THERMAL POV - he reaches out to the creature. He grabs  hold of it, firmly. Stroking it. The creature COOS. Matt  reaches for a hypo and brings it up to the creature. MATT (cont d) Just hold still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something clamps down on his hand, breaking his skin.  Blood erupts in a bite pattern. MATT (cont d) Ow, shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt drops the hypo and falls back. The cage door flies  open and something runs out. Matt pulls himself up to see the heat signature running down the hallway. He turns  around to see another heat signature coming at him. Matt  pulls off his goggles to see Linda coming up the  Corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bit me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. She s become a lot more  aggressive in the last few days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda takes the goggles from Matt. LINDA (cont d) Go take care of that bite. I ll get  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And give you a chance to pull ahead?  Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda opens a lock-box at the end of the hallway and  pulls out a two tranquilizer guns. She hands one to Matt.

dialogues.speaker: AROUND THE CORNER
dialogues.text: A slight distortion shimmers as something runs past us.  We hear HOOTS and FOOTSTEPS. Looking down the shadowy corridor, we hear grunting and a haunting heavy breathing. The control door is closed  though and something large and angry is throwing itself  against it. We can t see anything. A few moments later, Linda and Matt round the corner,  wearing goggles and leveling their pistols.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ala Porky) Shh. Be vewy, vewy quiet. I m hunting  simians.   heheheheh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock it off. (soothing voice) Isabelle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THERMAL POV - Dark hallway. Movement. A red shimmering  heat signature. It comes running at Linda. HOWLING. Linda fires. A T-DART flies. Thwack... It stops in mid-air.  Then falls. But it doesn t hit the floor. Instead, it  stops inches above the ground.  THERMAL POV - the heat signature lies in a heap at  Linda s feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good shootin , Tex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What s that make it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I m still ahead. 6 to 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a smug gunfighter, Linda blows imaginary smoke from  the top of her tranquilizer gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I m catching up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors open and Sebastian steps out. He s met by SARAH KENNEDY, early thirties, a fiery red-head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have a word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most normal people say good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don t you think you should test the  protocol on the liver samples before  you inject Isabelle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many tissue samples have we  successfully regressed? Hundreds,  right? How many have gone on to work  on the full system? None.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That s beside the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that is the point. I m not going  to waste six months of my life on an  outmoded testing procedure. This thing  works. I know it. I feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda comes down the corridor, listening in on the tail  end of the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. You can mop up afterward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I m going to kill Isabelle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill? More like liquefy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah, thank you for your opinion, but  I m the project leader. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She says ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... but somehow it feels like  Fuck you.  She storms off. Sebastian turns to Linda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you ever convince me to hire  her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you wanted the beat vet in  the country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well she cares more about the  animals than the research.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that s why she s so good.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: MATT as he shuts off the spinning cyclotron. As it s spinning slows to a halt, he pops the top and  reaches in, removing... A GLOWING VIAL OF ORANGE LIQUID. Sebastian peers at the vial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who da Man? You da Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we pull out we see we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost feels like a dungeon. Think high-tech  Frankenstein. Walls lined with video displays, technical  readouts, bizarre medical equipment. On a table in the middle of the room, a sheet drapes over a humanoid form, strapped down at it s invisible limbs.  The straps move slightly... ghostly. Wires lead from the  body to lots of machinery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Protocol is hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitals?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah, checks over the various readouts ... heartbeat,  blood pressure, the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARTER ABBEY, the late thirties lab assistant, wheels in  a cart of equipment. Linda taken a seat by the table and  pushes aside the sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIS IS GOD. YOU ARE DISTURBING THE NATURAL ORDER OF THINGS AND WILL BE SEVERELY PUNISHED FOR ALL ETERNITY. GOD HAS SPOKEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many times do I have to tell you,  Frank you aren t God. (beat) I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Boss. Forgot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian glance up at a glass booth overlooking the  Laboratory floor. TWO PEOPLE in the booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys ready to roll?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK CHASE, early thirties, and tech expert JANICE  WALTON, early twenties, man a small booth above the lab.  They re dressed more like band roadies than scientists. The room is crammed with electronic and recording  equipment. A handful of monitors display different images of the lab. Thermal and regular video. Another screen  monitors vital signs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are live and in color. On your  mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Janice looks down on their colleagues.  Sebastian nods their way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Roll  em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. We are rolling record on videos  one through twelve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank hits a series of buttons and speaks into a  microphone. Recording.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank s voice echoes through the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Subject Isabelle Two. Currently in  phase shift... one hundred twenty six  days, eighteen hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Testing De-Phase protocol. Injecting  serial protein Caine One Two Five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda removes a glowing vial of orange liquid from a  centrifuge nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if you stopped naming them after  yourself, you d have better luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why thank you, Dr. Kensington, for  that keen scientific observation. I ll  be sure to include it in my memoirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A whole mention? And I thought I was  just gonna be a footnote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt unwraps a hypodermic needle and jabs the needle into the vial, drawing up the colored liquid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Janice monitor Isabelle s vitals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tension in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Linda) Ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wraps a bungee cord around nothing and pulls it  tight. She then takes some dye and sprays it. A surface  appears, floating beneath the restraints. It sheens in  the light as Linda searches for a vein. She slaps the  surface several times. A small bulge appears, like a  vein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Propped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let s make some history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt lowers the hypo to the vein. But Sebastian takes the hypo from Matt s hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice try, Sparky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt relinquishes the needle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Isabelle. You can do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian lowers the hypo. The skin bonds and gives. The  needle remains in sight after it slips through the  visible surface. Matt presses down on the hypo plunger,  releasing a dye into his bloodstream. The gold liquid  twists into a long snaking tube up and down the limb.  It s the shape of a vein. The liquid begins to react.  Small flashes of light blip up and down the strand of  color. Ba-bump.. ba-bump... the heartbeat starts to speed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elevated heartbeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janice analyzes the screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We re still in the green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confirmed. Vitals still in the normal  range.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glowing liquid turns from gold to red as the complex  webbing of a bloodstream appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It s reacting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spreading out from the bloodstream, soon becomes  visible.. the shadow of a skeletal system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It s working. It s actually working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt pulls the sheet back. Muscles are beginning to  appear. And eyeballs. Frightened eyeballs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heart rate s up. She s scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah soothes her. SARAH (cont d) It's okay, baby. It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Subject began manifesting almost  Immediately. Protocol is reacting  quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabelle starts to struggle against her restraints. She  begins to howl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Subject may be in pain or extreme  discomfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit. Blood pressure elevating.  Brain activity going through the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brain appears, seemingly growing from the inside out. The shape of a large half-formed monkey grows from the  inside out. A SKULL APPEARS howling in pain, in horror. SARAH (cont d) We ve got a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What problem!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah checks her monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It s her heart. We can see the heart  beating in the ape s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got an erratic heart beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She s going into cardiac arrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got the crash cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter charges the crash cart and rolls it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We re losing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her machine flatlines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! It s got to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The body is only half there. It looks as if its caught in decomposition. Linda rubs the cardiac paddles together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda slams the paddles on the monkey s chest. The jolt  of electricity makes the monkey visible again for a brief moment. Then the skin and flesh fade away again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ve got something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heartbeat starts up again. The body continues its  march toward,visibility. SARAH (cont d) Still. erratic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Isabelle. Come on. You can do  it. You can fucking do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody s pulling for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, monkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it. Do it. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muscles spread like a rash on bone as the monkey twists  and turns, frightened. Then skin. The monkey howls. Skin  forms over the muscles reappearing like it was being  painted on before our eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stabilizing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire form glows, then blinks, then glows again, as  if it was discharging some stored energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brain activity returning to normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monkey grunts and groans. Blinks its eyes. Linda  hovers over it stroking its fur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome back, Isabelle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian puts his hand on Linda s shoulder... a move  that does not go unnoticed by Matt. We did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) How is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) I think she s gonna be okay

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, Matt, Sarah, Janice and Linda watch Isabelle rise  and walk about the cage. She goes over to the other  monkeys and joins in their grooming rituals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazing. She's normal, absolutely  healthy. If you didn't know any  better, you'd think nothing had  happened to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ribbing Sarah) Yeah. I can't wait to slice up her  brain and trace her neural pathways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw you, Matt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well maybe not right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should celebrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fanciest one in D.C. The entire eight person team sits around a round table,  drunk and laughing, as the last champagne flute is  filled. Sebastian raises his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the finest research team I've ever  known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A round of "Hear, hears" and they all clink glasses and  drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The din of the diners fades away as Linda slips out onto  the restaurant's balcony. She find Sebastian leaning  against a railing, breathing in the night air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where would I go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks out over the sweep of the city, the twinkling  lights of D.C. and darkness of the Potomac river. SEBASTIAN (cont'd) Twenty years ago there were no  computers, no fax machines, no cell  phones. I was just wondering what the  world will be like twenty years from  now... if what we're doing will change  everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little "I am become death... the  shatterer of worlds"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since the day I met, all you wanted to  do was change the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts her hand on his shoulder. LINDA (cont'd) Listen, I know we've... I mean... well  ... I just want you to know how proud  I am of you. I know it probably  doesn't mean a lot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually it does. (beat) I guess since you were there from the  beginning, you know me better than  anyone else on this godforsaken  planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're positively maudlin. You should  be happy. Do you have any idea what  you've accomplished?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... but I was working so hard, I  didn't realize I'd have no one to  share it with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian heads back inside. But he stops and turns back. SEBASTIAN (cont'd) I don't suppose we could turn back the  clock for a night and you could come  home with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her look says it all. Too much water under the bridge. SEBASTIAN (cont'd) Right. Sorry. Too much champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and heads back into the party. As he heads in he passes Matt heading out. He and Sebastian exchange  "Heys".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. It's just... He is who he is.  Sometimes I just have to be reminded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian wanders through the empty hallways of the  laboratory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian paces back and forth, examining the habitats.  He taps on the Plexiglas of one. The cubicle explodes  with BARKING. We see the Plexi steam up in one part, as if something  was breathing on it. As if a nose were pressed against  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little drunk) What's it like? Talk goddamnit! Tell  me what it's like!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flying over Washington D. C. , we cross the Potomac and  circle the five-cornered building, looking particularly  gloomy on this grey day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six years ago, this committee  commissioned me with a very specific  task...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the table are six men. A handful of senior military  brass and top civilian advisors direct their attention to the front of the room, where Sebastian, flanked by Matt  and Linda, is in the middle of his presentation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To successful phase-shift a human  being out of quantum sync with the  visible universe and then return him  safely, with no after affects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next to Sebastian a video shows a small monkey shifting  from the visible spectrum. It's hair, skin, organs and  skeletons slowly dissolve before our eyes. SEBASTIAN (cont'd) Well, we found out sending them to  "never-never-land" was easy, it's the  getting back that's hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian fast forwards a few moments until the video  screen shows the bizarrely tangled heap of flesh and bone that used to be alive. SEBASTIAN (cont'd) Every time we've tried to bring a test  subject back from phase-shift.  Cellular bonds would dissolve, the  primary DNA strands would decay. But  now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian pauses. Something's bothering him. SEBASTIAN (cont'd) But now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the senior advisers, DR. HARRY KRAMER,  distinguished 50s, finally breaks the silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda and Matt look up at Sebastian expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But now... (pause) But now, we feel we are closer than  ever to resolving this issue. We've  been experimenting with a new  regression formula that looks rather  promising. A FOUR STAR GENERAL leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son, as you can imagine, we are very  anxious to field test this tactical  asset. How long till you resolve this  issue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda starts to speak, but Sebastian cuts her off with a  look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't be more than another year,  Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frustrated sighs all around the room. SEBASTIAN (cont'd) Maybe sooner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Linda, Matt and Sebastian head to their cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo. Reality check! What the hell was  that about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your voice down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The protocol works. Why'd you tell  them it didn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't ready for them to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they're the oversight committee.  They're supposed to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure he had a reason. (firmly) You did have a reason, didn't you,  Sebastian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had more than a reason. I had a  goddamn epiphany.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach his Porsche. SEBASTIAN (cont'd) What do you think they'd do if they  know we could send a subject into  phase shift and pull it back out  again? How many seconds would it take  for them to take over the whole  project, bringing in their soldiers to  test the formula on. We'd have lost  control of it by the end of the week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's their money, Sebastian. It's  going to happen eventually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But not yet. There's too much  for us to learn. I don't want my hands  tied by their political agenda when we  go to phase three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then... mind telling us how  you're gonna get a human test-subject  for phase three without the committee  finding out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's easy. I've decided to test the  procedure ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... on myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team sits around the conference table. Their jaws  drop and they stare at him with wide eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you nuts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was Jonas Salk nuts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Pretty sure he was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And remember, for every Jonas Salk,  there are a bunch of guys who aren't  famous cuz they died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we're that unsure, how can we  morally justify testing it on someone  else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it a little soon to be moving  into phase three anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's right. We haven't even finished  collating the phase two research.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have plenty of time to collate  and cross-reference later. Monkey data  doesn't matter anyway. The only real  data is human data.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't even know if any of the  protocols will work on humans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are we gonna find out? Besides,  we've succeeded with a gorilla and  their DNA is 98% the same as humans.  And the 2% is not that significant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian ... humans can talk, build  houses and cook in microwave ovens.  Gorilla's live in trees. That's a  helluva 2% if you ask me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all concerned. I know that. But  if we're gonna move forward ever, this  is something we have to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you? Why not one of us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The risks. I couldn't ask...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) What if we volunteer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if you're too valuable to lose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Project Leader. It's my formula  and my call. The best way to express  your concern is to make damn sure you  do your best work. I'll want about  four weeks to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To put your affairs in order?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To run some more reversions and tissue  tests and then we'll attempt the phase  shift. I'll stay shifted for three  days of testing and then we'll perform  a quantum regression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A knock on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda pushes into the room and closes the door behind  her. SEBASTIAN (cont'd) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the past six years, I've never once  challenged your decisions, but this  ... Sebastian. I don't think you  should do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh please. How long were we together?  You must've said it a million times  ... Nobody knows who built the lunar  lander. All they remember in the first  man on the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian shrugs and nods. LINDA (cont'd) But what if something happens to  you... what about the project?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lin, trust me... nothing's going to  happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda and Matt are in bed together. Matt kisses her way  up and down her arm. But Linda is distracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He refuses to listen to reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we talk about this later? I'm  trying to make love to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I just can't let it go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt props himself up on the pillow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how you're feeling. Hell, he  and I've been friends since freshman  year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how can we let him do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if you were given the opportunity  to be the first person on ,Mars, would  you go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a heartbeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if they didn't know whether or  not they could get you home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda thinks about it. It's still tempting. MATT (cont'd) This is his chance to be Chuck Yeager  or Christopher Columbus. Well, if I  were him I'd do the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt goes back to kissing Linda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me ask another question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is about who gets to be on top?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the human race really ready for  what we're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt groans and rolls over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you always get philosophical  before we're about to get physical?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No really. Is it ready? We're  barrelling down a road that begs moral  and ethical questions that I don't  think we can answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said the same thing about the  bomb. They said we'd never survive the  nuclear age... but here we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This night is still young. (beat) I mean, when you think about it, it's  creepy. Do we really want to live in a  world where people can just disappear  in the blink of an eye?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We made our deal with the devil years  ago. Might as well stick around to  cash in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian stripped to his shorts paces nervously. A knock on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his voice catches) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt sticks his head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian nervously shakes his limbs out. Then nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not too late to back out. I'm  happy to take your place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt leads him into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they walk down the corridor toward the lab...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nervous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever tell you the one about Superman  and Wonder Woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Superman's flying around the city,  and he's horny as hell.  Lo and behold  he looks down and sees Wonder Woman,  completely nude, sunning herself up on  the roof of the Justice League. I mean  she is lying there naked and spread  eagle. So Superman starts thinking,  "man... this is too easy. I could go  down there, do a little fast pumping  and be gone before she even sees me."  After all he is faster than a speeding  bullet, right? Anyway, he swoops down,  takes care of business so quick, you  can't even see him. Well ... I tell  ya. Wonder Woman looks up, surprised  as hell and says "What the hell was  that." And the Invisible Man replies  "I dunno know, but it sure hurt like  hell."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian shoots Matt a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, that could be the last joke  I ever hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, man. That's funny shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The buzz of conversation is punctuated by an amplified  HEARTBEAT, thumping its familiar rhythm. Bah-bump.  Bah-bump. In the center of the room, Sebastian, dressed  only in a pair of jogging shorts is strapped to a table  inclined at a 45 degree angle. Electrodes are strapped to his body. An I.V. tube snakes from the needle in his vein up to a bag of saline solution. Dripping slowly. Linda  makes last minute checks of some of the equipment. She  pats Sebastian on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O.K. How're you feeling?  Sebastian takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah checks his vitals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulse 88, BP 140 over 95. A bit  elevated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To be expected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reason for concern. He's ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda takes a moment and studies Sebastian's face. She's  almost teary eyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... it's gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda nods. Back to business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start recording.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janice hits record on the equipment decks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're hot. All systems nominal,  Houston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank coordinates all the data being fed into the  computers. He pushes a series of buttons and speaks into  a microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, kids. Let's make some history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's voice echoes through the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Subject: Male, Age 29, weight 166 lbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt jabs a hypodermic into small vial of colored liquid. Draws up 20ccs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Linda) Ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda takes the hypo from Matt. MATT (cont'd) If the tests are any indication it  should work quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll inject myself. If anything goes  wrong, they can't blame you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands the hypo Sebastian and steps away. Sebastian  stares at the golden formula silently for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can still shut down, Sebastian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any last words?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. If I'm killed, pretend I said  something deep and clever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then... Back to business. He inserts the needle into the  I.V. Sebastian. Presses into himself and depresses the  plunger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Injection was administered at (checks watch) ... 18:23:47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The colored liquid snakes it's way into his bloodstream. LINDA (cont'd) Keep talking. Tell us what you're  feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing so far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitals are stable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wait and watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another moment passes by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Human DNA structure is slightly more  complex... it's possible that it may  take more time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another moment passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we overlooked something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recheck the protocol. It can't be non-  reactive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinda like a firecracker with a bad  fuse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian shoots Carter a questioning look. CARTER (cont'd) Don't know if it'll go off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the booth) No change in bio-electric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another long pause. Sebastian concentrates. SEBASTIAN (cont'd) Okay wait, my arm... it's getting a  bit warm... yeah, it's ... it's  starting to tingle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excitement overtakes the room. SEBASTIAN (cont'd) Okay... it's spreading to my back...  like, like a fever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly the flesh on Sebastian's arm begins dissolving,  revealing the complex network of nerves, blood vessels  and flesh beneath it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit... it's starting to burn... Oh  god. It hurts. I didn't think it would  hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HEART BEAT thumps faster, accelerating

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heartbeat's elevated. Pulse at 100. ... 130 ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you feel? Keep talking. KEEP  TALKING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulse is 165 ... 170 Blood pressure  180 over 100. ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to blow out his heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prop the crash cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter grabs the crash cart, rolls it in. Matt tears off  the I.V. leads into Sebastian's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the monitors are going crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank leans into the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen up! Electric activity  increasing in all limbs. Brainwaves  are through the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think the human brain could  spike that high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian screams in dire pain. He struggles against his  restraints as his skin liquefies into a muscular mass.  It's like something's eating away at him. Gruesome. The  yells become louder and more painful to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Oh god! NO! STOP IT! STOP IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The muscular system begins to dissolve, leaving a  struggling skeleton wrapped with tentacular blood vessels and stuffed with the major organs. The beating heart, the heaving lungs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulse is 180 .... holding stable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screaming.... Then the organs go. Then the blood vessels. Leaving only a skeleton howling in pain. The jawbones  spread wide ... Screaming... screaming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then as if someone had poured acid all over the bones,  the skeleton evaporates into nothingness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulse is dropping. 170.. 150 .... 160..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is NOTHING left of Sebastian Caine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bio-quantum phase shift occurred at 18:26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screaming continues and the restraints continue to  twist and turn. Suddenly the restraints go limp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda checks the readouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He passed out from the trauma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitals returning to normal. Pulse 110  ... dropping. Blood pressure 130 over  75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat as everybody's eyes stare at the instruments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Electrical activity is stabilizing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulse steady at 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Un-fucking-believable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A reverent pause as Linda runs her fingers over what  would be his skin. Small electrical charge dance around  her fingertips. She gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers in his ear) You did it, Sebastian. You're the  first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get him into recovery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chamber is half constructed out of Plexiglas at the  end of the Hallway of Habitats. On the recovery bed, a sheet drapes over Sebastian's  invisible body. The gentle bleatings of medical machinery pound out a dulling rhythm. Linda sleeps in a corner chair as Matt slips into the  room. He checks the readouts on Sebastian then takes a  seat by Linda. She wakes with a start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S'okay. You nodded off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His breathing's hypnotic. How long's  it been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventeen hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the others?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the lab crunching numbers. We've  got enough data there for two  lifetimes of research.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda rubs her temples and gestures to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep looking at that hole, wondering  if he's really there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She notices something out of the corner of his eye. The  sheet twitches. LINDA (cont'd) Did you see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sheet twitches again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He may be coming out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda and Matt watch intently. Then suddenly... the  sheets thrash violently. A yell of pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights! Turn off the goddamn  lights! Ah Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda jumps up and crosses to Sebastian. Matt rushes to  the wall and turns off the lights. Darkness. The room is  lit by the glow of machinery. SEBASTIAN'S VOICE (cont'd) I can't... I can't close my eyes. I  can't close my eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your eyelids are transparent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sheets slowly stop thrashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I ... I'm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My arms. I can.. where? ... I can feel  them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your arms ... your whole body... It  worked, Sebastian. It worked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sheet rises and slips away. The wires, seemingly  connected to thin air, spread out like a spider's web and then fall away one-by-one. The monitors all go dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mirror. I ... I want to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt motions to a dark corner of the room, toward a  mirror and sink. We push in on the mirror. No reflection. Suddenly it fogs up ... Sebastian's breath. A finger  tracing appears in the fog ... but of course we see no  finger. The sink faucet twists on and water runs. It cups into the shape of hands and lifts into the air, splashing against the surface of Sebastian's face. Beads of water  cling to his f ace, outlining it I shape f or a moment  before dripping away. MATT (cont'd) What was it like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ... It's hard to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian's voice is now behind him. Matt turns around. SEBASTIAN'S VOICE (cont'd) The transformation... I remember every  molecule in my body shattering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was painful?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first... but then everything went  black. I couldn't see or hear or feel  anything. It was all just black...  like I wasn't connected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your system received quite a shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least my senses are starting to  return... You're wearing your  Shalimar, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda realizes that he's standing very close by. Her hair lifts slightly and Sebastian inhales. Chills go down her  spine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda's hair drops back to her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is weird. I'm looking through  myself at the floor. I'm looking right  through myself. I can't tell ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bumps into a chair. SEBASTIAN'S VOICE (cont'd) ... where my body is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. Linda and Matt look at each other, slightly  alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An indentation forms on the bed a moment later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really can't see me. Can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme symptoms. Dizziness, nausea,  headache, body-ache, disorientation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, just tired. (beat) It's funny. I can see everything...  more than before... but I can't see  myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter, Frank, Janice and Sarah work at various research  stations. The door opens and Linda and Matt enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. How's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you ask him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda motions to the gap between her and Matt. The four  of them stare at the nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian, how do you feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to bad, considering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn round. The voice is coming from behind them.  The group rises from their various workstations and turn  toward where the voice came from. SEBASTIAN'S VOICE (cont'd) Odd, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rheostat switch on the wall turns and the lights dim.  Though it's a simple act, it feels somewhat ominous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't close his eyes so they're  sensitive to light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda's explanation puts everyone at ease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what was it like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian has moved. As everyone turns toward him again,  he can't stifle a slight giggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Sebastian. Knock it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Couldn't resist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice again come s from somewhere else in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like we're playing Marco Polo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I see the procedure hasn't  changed your personality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank pulls on a pair of THERMAL GOGGLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No worries. I'm on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THERMAL POV - Every body in the laboratory shows up as a  heat signature, including Sebastian. Frank points. FRANK (cont'd) Gotcha, big man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THERMAL POV - The HEAT SIGNATURE reaches for a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, you people have no sense of  humor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chair slides back from a desk and bends under  Sebastian's weight. SEBASTIAN'S VOICE (cont'd) Show me. So ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Janice shuttle the playback controls as a VIDEO MONITOR re-plays various angles of Sebastian's phase  shift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank halts the tape. SEBASTIAN'S VOICE (cont'd) Index that. That was when it started  burn. Epidermal reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Index Mark. 112125.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janice scribble the numbers in her notebook. Linda  crosses, nursing a cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late. Time you got some rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a little longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hate to pull rank, but you're my  patient now and you need rest. We've  got a busy day tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heavy sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Linda enters she points to a small camera in the upper corner of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've set up a thermal camera for  observation and I've arranged one of  us to be here 24/7 in case you need  anything. The team's gonna be on alpha- call alert for the duration. If  anything goes wrong, we can all be  here within...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty minutes. Yes,,_I know. I wrote  the procedure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was trying to be reassuring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like this don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being in charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's clear she does. But she's certainly not going to  admit it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. I'm just doing my job.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A video screen. A thermal lump lays stretched  out on the bed. Pull back to reveal SARAH staring at the screen. We are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bank of monitors display the various angles of the Hall of Habitats, the laboratory and, of course, Sebastian in  the recovery room. Linda hands Sarah a cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna be okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. It's not like I have anything  else going on in my sad pathetic life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter'll be in at six to spell you  and I'll be in by nine. Call me if  anything happens, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the glass wall, Linda sees Matt knocking and  waving her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. Go on ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of the team straggles into the elevator.  Yawning. Exhausted from the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I'm tired. That was a long day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Days only get longer from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda catches Matt's eye. Gives him a look. "You coming  over?" Matt nods, "yes", imperceptible to everyone but  Linda. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deserted and dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late. Sarah rubs her temples. Her eyelids are heavy.  She's having real trouble staying awake. The buzzing  fluorescent light isn't helping either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sheets ruffle and the indentation disappears from the bed. We can hear breathing and soft sound of bare feet  shuffling against linoleum. CAMERA SLOWLY PANS toward the door, as if we, are  following someone walking. The door handle turns and the door pushes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SLOWLY TRACK DOWN the Hallway of the Habitats. We hear the sounds of sleeping creatures. A couple of them growl  at something unseen. The growling follows the invisible  something as it passes by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The laboratory door opens and shuts again. Ghostly. We  see papers shuffling at one of the work stations. A glass moves slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah reclines in her chair. Fast asleep, Behind her is  the glass wall, revealing the empty hallway behind it. But a small portion of the glass fogs, as if someone had  just breathed on it. As the fogged part quickly clears,  we see the door to the observation room quietly open. ON SARAH, still sleeping. We hear a whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Sarah. Are you awake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her heavy breathing mixes with Sebastian's. SEBASTIAN'S VOICE (cont'd) (barely audible) Hmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah's hair moves slightly, as if a hand were running  through it. And then we see her shirt move, like fingers  were tracing over it. Down from the shoulder to her  breast. Around her nipple. Sarah moans slightly, as if  she were dreaming, but she doesn't stir. And then her  breasts cup slightly, as if they were being touched...  softly... gently. Her breathing becomes harder, more  labored, erotic... and then she... BOLTS AWAKE. Bar eyes  wide with fear. She jumps and cups her own breasts and  looks around the room. It's empty, of course. She jumps  over to the monitor and checks on Sebastian's room. The  heat signature isn't there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Caine! Goddamnit, Dr. Caine! Are  you in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She listens. It's silent. She tries holding her breath,  listening for his breathing. But there's nothing. Sarah reaches over to a microphone. Hits a few switches. SARAH (cont'd) Dr. Caine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Caine, please report in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Caine, report in please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah waits. No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around the room. He must be in here. SARAH (cont'd) Dr. Caine? Sebastian? Come on, this  isn't funny. I know you're in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. No response. Sarah waves her hand around,  reaching out, trying to find him. After a few beats she  stops and rubs her head. SARAH (cont'd) I must be going crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Sarah gets an idea. She quickly exits the  observation room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a wall storage box, she removes a pair of Thermal  Goggles and slips them on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah enters wearing the thermals. She scans the room. THERMAL POV - The room is empty. She pulls the goggles off in frustration, and when she  glances over at the video screen, she sees Sebastian's  thermal image lying on the bed in the recovery room. Sarah sinks into her chair, a tad disconcerted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda and Matt finish listening to Sarah's story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found him later in the lab, running  samples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you call me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I wasn't sure. I'm still not.  I mean, I could've easily been  dreaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't sound like something  Sebastian would do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I feel so stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I mean... (she torn, unsure of herself) It was probably nothing. I  shouldn't've mentioned it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm sure. I mean, y'know, why  would he do that, right? Just, this  place at night can be kinda creepy,  y'know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian, wearing surgical scrubs sits in an examination chair. Wire leads sprout from the electrodes covering his head and arms. The electrodes seem to outline his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how was your first night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Restless. Hard to sleep when you can't  close your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sebastian talks, we can see the electrodes around his  jaw pump up and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? What'd you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got up a couple of times. Knocked  about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Sarah mentioned you weren't in  your cubicle. She said she called you  over the intercom and you didn't  respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I didn't hear. I had the radio  on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'd be helpful to us if you'd tell  whoever's on duty where you're going  to. I mean, if something were to  happen, we'd want to know where to  find you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think it was a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't. I just don't want it to  become one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Machines pump out EEG, EKG readouts. Matt studies them. MATT (cont'd) Readings are normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next I want to run a VV and UVF  analysis of the platelets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to draw some more blood.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Sarah rolls up Sebastian's sleeve, revealing empty air.  She wraps a bungee cord around the nothing, pulls it  tight and sprays the inside of his elbow with dye. She  acts very self conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just seem a little nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I...I'm fine. Hold still. This  might hurt a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surface of his skin sheens in the light as Linda  searches for a vein. She slaps his arm several times,  then plunges a hypodermic needle into his skin. His skin  bends and gives. The needle remains in sight after it  slips through the visible surface. Sarah presses down on  the hypo plunger, releasing a dye into his bloodstream. SARAH (cont'd) Dr. Caine... this might sounds stupid,  but are you... are you looking at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The red dye twists into a long snaking red tube up and  down his arm. His vein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I was looking at the clock. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah draws the plunger back, sucking Sebastian's blood  into the hypodermic and then yanks the needle out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just felt like someone was staring at  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah pulls the vial off the needle and labels it with a  grease pencil. After a few beats the red dye in  Sebastian's blood stream dissolves and disappears, as  does the liquid in the vial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATT slides Sebastian's sheet covered frame into an MRI.  Even though his head is not visible, it shown up on the  MRI scanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARTER and SARAH lower a harness into a water tank.  SEBASTIAN'S BODY displaces the water, revealing an empty  body shaped cavity in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARTER sips a BIG GULP and stares at a monitor which  shows two eat signatures in the Recovery Chamber, huddled over a chess game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on a chessboard... A BLACK KNIGHT takes WHITE BISHOP,  seemingly all by itself. Across the table, Matt leans back and topples his WHITE  KING acknowledging defeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dim lights. Janice and Frank both don eye guards. Frank  switches on a low intensity laser on and it's beam shoots across the room. The beam distorts slightly in the center of the room. As Frank widens the spectral pattern,  suddenly the beam splits into a million different  spectral rainbows, momentary illuminating Sebastian's  entire frame in a glowing tingle of light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LINDA pulls vials from the cyclotrons and props blood  sample slides. She slips them under the microscope. She  takes a sip of her Diet Coke and puts it on the table.  She pears into the microscope and analyses the blood  sample, squeezing more stain onto it. She looks up to  make notations, but when she reaches for her Diet Coke IT ISN'T THERE. She looks around. It's on the other side of  her microscope. She shrugs it off, she takes a sip and  sets it down where it was before. She peers into the  microscope again and when she looks up... the Diet Coke  is gone. She looks around the room and sees it on another table completely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian? Goddamnit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear Sebastian's laughter echo in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've no idea how much fun I've had.  I'm going to hate going back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what worries me.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens when we turn the project  over to the Army. Ever wonder how much  fun they're gonna have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we won't give it to them. His  voice comes from behind her now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see indentations on her shoulders where his fingers  press down. SEBASTIAN'S VOICE (cont'd) I was thinking... tonight's my last  night. Ever fantasize about making  love to an invisible man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda pulls away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, Sebastian. It's not funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't do it for me. Do it for  science.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda walks away. Sebastian laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grow up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh well. Missed your big chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got some sleep. Big day tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bevy of activity below us as the scientists prepare.  Matt slides the antigen cocktail into the centrifuge and  starts it spinning. A sheet drapes over a Sebastian's frame, straps across  his limbs. He is fully wired. Linda looks up to the observation booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recording?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank peers down at her from the booth, his voice echoing through the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recording. Subject Doctor Sebastian  Caine. Currently in phase shift...  Three days, seven hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: De-Phase protocol. Injecting Serial  Protein Caine One Two Seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt removes the glowing vial of orange liquid from a  centrifuge nearby. Carter hands Matt a hypo. Matt jabs it into the vial, drawing up the colored liquid. Linda  sprays Sebastian's arm with dye. LINDA (cont'd) Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. I was just starting to  enjoy myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, man. Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt inserts the hypo into the vein and presses down on  the plunger. The liquid begins to react. Small flashes of light blip up and down the strand of color outlining the  vein. Ba-bump.. ba-bump... the heartbeat starts to speed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait... something... something doesn't  feel right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heartbeat elevated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janice and Frank look over the equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitals still nominal..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glowing liquid turns from gold to red as the complex  webbing of a bloodstream appears. Spreading out from the bloodstream, soon becomes visible  ... the shadow of a skeletal system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't br... br...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian begins wheezing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muscles are beginning to appear. And eyeballs. Frightened eyeballs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Subject manifesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulse erratic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian pulls against his bonds. One set tears off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter grabs onto the mass of flesh and muscle, trying to hold it back. But the restraints snap. The half-visible  man is screaming. He grabs Carter and throws him across  the room. LINDA (cont'd) Sebastian! Sebastian!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just for a second, Sebastian is fully visible. And  free. He looks around like a scared animal and rips off  all the wiring. LINDA (cont'd) Sebastian!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a tranq. Stat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah preps a tranquilizer. Sebastian locks eyes with  Linda. He's lost, he doesn't know where he is. And  suddenly, he crumbles to the ground. Linda rushes over to him and puts bar hand on his shoulder. Light bleeds from  his skin and his skin begins to dissolve from sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's reverting. Got him on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt, Linda and Sarah pull the shifting body up and onto  an operating table. Carter pulls himself up and heads  back to the group. LINDA (cont'd) Get me a I.V. of A.G. seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got no pulse. No pulse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start CPR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter locates Sebastian's heart, not a difficult thing  because we can actually see it. Carter's hand pushes down in the air inches above the heart. We see the heart being pushed and squeezed. Sarah slaps an air bag on Sebastian  and starts pumping air into his lungs. Sebastian's heart  begins to beat again, beat on its own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting a pulse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit. What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian... can you hear me? Can you  hear me? How are his pupils?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see his goddamn pupils!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's going into shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We slowly FADE OUT to the sights and sounds of our  scientist- doctors working on Sebastian... And the  beeping of Sebastian's erratic heartbeat.

dialogues.speaker: A HABITAT
dialogues.text: The heartbeat continues. In the shadows, two Rhesus  Monkeys defend themselves against an unseen attacker.  Blood splatters against the Plexiglas wall. We FADE OUT AGAIN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda stares through the Plexiglas walls into the  Recovery Chamber. Inside the Chamber, Sarah and Carter- eye the various screens monitoring Sebastian's vitals. Linda watches the hollow pocket underneath the blanket.  She watches the rhythm of its rises and falls as  Sebastian sleeps. Matt comes up behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just got the tissue sample results.  Cellular cohesion is stable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda exhales in relief. Matt puts his hands on her  shoulder. Pulls her close to him. MATT (cont'd) How bout you? You gonna be okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess so. (beat) I was just thinking about the Apollo  missions. Y'know? Grissom, White and  Chaffee... What it was like for them  on that launch pad that day, thinking  they were gonna reach the stars only  to burn to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes the test pilots make  history. Sometimes the planes crash  and people die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he didn't die, did he? (beat) What if we can't bring him back? What  then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a little hitch is all. He'll  be the first to tell that he'll crack  it and I'm sure he will. It'll just  take time. (beat) Listen, let's got out of here. We  could drive up to the old observatory.  We'll take some wine and go count the  stars and forget all this for awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I want to be here for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda pushes through the door of the recovery chamber and takes a seat by Sebastian's bedside. A little hurt, Matt  heads down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
