dialogues.text: Frank and Janice are staring into their coffee when Matt  enters. Matt crosses to the coffee machine and pours  himself a cup. He takes a seat at the table. They all  drink their coffee in silent vigil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda sits by Sebastian's bedside, listening to the  constant rhythm of the machines. The sheets shift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weak) Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I guess it didn't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look worried. It must've been bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian's voice is weak and strained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You almost died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, remember your Nietchze. Whatever  doesn't kill me, makes me stronger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should be making you feel better.  Not vice versa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess if I'm going to be stuck this  way for awhile, I'd better make some  adjustments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a dusty shaft of light... A cotton swab. is dipped by a gloved hand into a jar of flesh-colored  cream make-up. We follow the hand as it raises the cotton swab into the darkness. The swab strokes over the black  and the rich fleshy cream spreads, revealing... EYE LIDS of a closed eye. The eyelids part, unveiling... PITCH BLACK. Blink. Blink. No eye. Not even a trace of a eye socket. Just darkness. A COLORED CONTACT LENS floats through mid-air... hovering before the eyelids. It turns and fastens itself to the  darkness between the lids. We PULL BACK slowly as Sebastian lifts a latex FACE MASK  and pulls it over his head. He checks his reflection in the mirror. He looks almost  human. Almost. A face, eyes, hands ... the rest of him  covered by surgical scrubs. We pull back and see the rest of the team looking on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The latex'll limit the amount of light  delivered to my optic nerves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could almost pass for human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian rises. He looks eerily removed from reality  with his cold blank expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it gives you a face to talk to  at least, and we can all work in  normal light again.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: Carter draws blood from Sebastian. Samples are placed into the cyclotron. Matt peers through the eyepiece of a microscope. He makes notes. Frank and Janice finish a computer simulation on a  protein strand. Matt looks over. They shake their heads,  no. Sebastian slides into the MRI. Linda examines a petri dish. She throws her pencil down  in frustration. Sebastian is hit by the spectral radiation beams. Matt pulls a vial of orange liquid from the cyclotron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian, still in his latex and scrubs, but looking  like he's been dragged through the nine levels of  purgatory, is escorted back to the recovery chamber by  Linda and Matt. He crosses to his bed and collapses on it. Closes his  eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The testing's making me sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be the barium or the radiation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're physiology has changed and,  well, all bets are off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe I have to spend  another night here. (to Linda) Suppose you're gonna go home now, meet  up with that boyfriend of yours now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda and Matt exchange a glance. Linda quickly covers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to stay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That's okay. It's just, being a  guinea pig is more work than I  thought. I'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various shots of the empty hallways and deserted labs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter kicks back in his chair listening to his walkman  stereo and playing gameboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian, in scrubs and make-up, paces back and forth. He slams the wall in frustration. He crosses to a mirror  and examines himself. He doesn't look half bad. He pokes  his cheeks. There's something about him that's a little  off, but only if you look close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shadow falls across Carter's face. He looks up. It's  Sebastian wearing street clothes - jeans and a hooded  sweatshirt over his latex mask. Carter pulls of his earphones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Dr. Caine. What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just stopped by to let you know, I'm  going out for a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian turns back into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going out? Hey wait a sec!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter scrambles to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter catches up with Sebastian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean going out for a bit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I don't get out of here, I'm gonna  go crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're not supposed to leave the  compound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the rule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but I made that rule. It's my  rule and I'm changing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't just change it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian hits the elevator button. The doors open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter, I was suppose to be like this  for three days. Three fucking days and  I'll be damned if I'm going to spend  the rest of my life as a prisoner in  this godforsaken dump. Now I'm going  out. I'll be back in a couple of  hours. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors close with Sebastian inside. Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter runs down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: INT OBSERVATION ROOM
dialogues.text: Carter picks up the phone and dials. A beat then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's Carter. We got a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors open and Sebastian pushes past the  Marine Guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Doc. Haven't seen you for awhile?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian keeps his face turned away as he crosses to his Porsche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well. You know how it in  sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got that right, sir. I was  beginning to worry 'cause your car  hadn't moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, but everything's cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian starts his car. It chugs a few times before  turning over and speeding out of the warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Sebastian switches on the lights. He looks around his apartment and sighs. It's good to be  home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian enters the bedroom, clicking on the light. He  looks at the ceiling, "You Should Be Working", and  smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda and Matt each rush to their respective cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He could be anywhere. Hell he could be  right behind us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll meet you at the lab. I'm gonna  swing by his place, just in case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt tries to give her a quick pack. Linda backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly, looking around) I don't want him to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around too) What a mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get in their cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian packs up a few personal belongings in an  overnight duffle. He crosses to his bookcase and pulls  out some books and throws them into the bag. But as he does, he notices a light come on in the window  across the courtyard. Sebastian turns off his bedroom  light and moves toward the window. He peers across the  courtyard into the Brunette's apartment. He watches the Brunette as she comes into the living room from her front hallway. She drops her keys on the table  and begins unbuttoning her blouse as she crosses to the  window. Just as the blouse slips off her shoulder, she  pulls her blinds shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frustrated, Sebastian steps away from the window and then stops. Something has occurred to him. SEBASTIAN (cont'd) Don't even think it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down and notices his hand is trembling. His  breathing is a little heavy. A little nervous. He catches a glimpse at himself in the mirror. SEBASTIAN (cont'd) (almost whispering) Once...just once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Brunette's living room light switches off and the  bathroom light switches on. We see him fighting an  internal battle and we see him lose it. He grabs a hold  of his hand and peels the latex skin off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda drives Sebastian's apartment. She spots his black  Porsche in the parking lot. She pulls over to the curb,  jumps out of her car and heads into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing just a robe, the brunette turns on her shower.  The doorbell rings. With a frustrated sigh, the brunette  rises.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: She peers through the peep hole. No one's there. But as  she turns she hears the doorbell again. She opens the  door, steps out into the hallway and looks around. Empty. Puzzled she heads back inside her apartment. We follow her as she crosses to her bedroom, but a moment later, the bedroom door closes on its own. We hear a SCREAM come from the other side. Then another.  Then a muffled struggled. And we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda exits the elevator and heads down to Sebastian's  door. She knocks. Waits. No answer. She knocks again.  Waits. And then she tries the door. It's unlocked. She pushes  the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda pushes through the living room, into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She notices that the bathroom light is on.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: On the floor she finds Sebastian's clothing and on the  vanity she sees his latex face and hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She scramble for the bedroom phone and quickly dials. LINDA (cont'd) Yeah, Matt, it's me. He was here. No.  He's taken his make-up off. I don't  know...He must be outside somewhere. I don't know where he went. I'm coming  back to the lab. How? How'm I supposed  to do that? I CAN'T FUCKING SEE HIM!  We're going on alpha call.  I want  everyone at the lab now. We're gonna  need thermal visors and we may need  tranqs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she hangs up the phone, and heads out. The CAMERA  doesn't follow, but instead pushes through the blinds and out the window. As we cross the courtyard, we begin to  hear muffled cries of terror. We hold on the Brunette's  window as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bedroom door opens and we see the Brunette, nude and  curled up on the bed, sobbing. We follow the sounds of  heavy breathing to the front door of her apartment. The  door opens and we push out into the hallway. We can see  indentations of feet appear on the hallway carpet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors open and Linda steps inside. The doors close shut behind her. A beat later we see the  indentations of footsteps come around the corner. We  follow the breathing and stumbling footfalls back into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We push over to the bathroom sink. The faucet turns on  and the water starts running. We see the water cup under the faucet and splash against  Sebastian's face. His face appears briefly in the water.  Then the water slips away. For second it sounds like he's crying, but then we hear  something far worse. He's laughing. Nervous laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt hands out thermal goggles, while Frank loads and  passes out tranquilizer guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are the tranqs for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use your imagination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you saying he's dangerous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just saying we need to be  cautious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Metro stops running after midnight  and he's on foot, so he can't have  gotten too far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, this isn't a monkey we're  talking about. It's Dr. Caine. Don't  you think you're over reacting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This program is classified. If he's  out there it means someone might find  out about him. He could destroy the  whole program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, Linda. No one's gonna find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all turn around. At the door is Sebastian, back in  his latex outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a little stir crazy, so I went  to my apartment to pick up some stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit! I went to your apartment and  I happen to know you did a helluva lot  more than pick some stuff up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, of all people How could you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caught dead to rights, Sebastian sinks into his chair. He thinks she knows. LINDA (cont'd) You put yourself and this project at  risk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what did you see in my apartment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw your face and your clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was bad enough you left without an  escort, but to take off the... (he motions to his face) out in public?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian realizes that they don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make a mountain out of molehill.  I didn't let anyone see me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not good enough. When you're  outside the lab there are a thousand  variables none of us can control. It's  just not safe for you to be out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Linda. You don't expect me to  be some kind of prisoner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You volunteered for this, Sebastian.  You knew going in there could be  consequences. (beat) For the security of this project, I'm  gonna have to ask you to confine  yourself to the compound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still Project Leader, Linda. It's  my decision to make.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. It's your decision. But  if you leave the compound again, I'll  notify the oversight committee. Then  they can make the decision. You  understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, man. You'd do the same if it  were the other way around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat. Sebastian slowly rises, acknowledges Linda  with a nod and leaves the room. Linda looks around at her silent co-workers, the goggles and tranqs still on the  table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pack 'em up... Everyone go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lab is buzzing with the usual activity. Linda rolls  up Sebastian's sleeve, revealing nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wraps a bungee cord around the nothing and pulls it  tight. She then sprays the inside of his elbow with dye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (contentious) How much blood do you think you've  taken so far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surface of his skin sheens in the light as Linda  searches for a vein. She slaps his arm several times,  then plunges a hypodermic needle into his skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not enough to worry about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every day... feels like you're sucking  me dry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda presses down on the hypodermic plunger, releasing a dye into his bloodstream. SEBASTIAN (cont'd) It's funny. All these years I've known  you, I never pegged you for a  megalomanic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shoe being on the other foot. You  getting to run things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't ask for this, Caine. But when  a classified experiment disappears in  the middle of the night, someone's  gotta run the show. (tries sympathy) Look, I know how hard this has been  for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knocks her arm away and pulls the hypo, out of his  arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't patronize me. (beat) And for the record, you've got no idea  what it's like. I get up every morning  and you people stick needles in me.  You bombard me with radiation until I  vomit. And then at six it's over for  you. You get to go home. But Sebastian  is still here. Sebastian can't leave,  or else. That's the worst part, you  know. Here I have this ... this GIFT  and I can't even use it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it's a gift?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're goddamn right it's a gift. And  if you weren't so goddamned short  sighted, I'd be out there right now  trying to master it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian looks around at the other scientists staring at him. He tosses the hypo with the needle onto the  instrument tray and heads toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where're you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like I'm going nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, man. We've got a ton of tests  scheduled today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do them yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda enters to find Sebastian reading the collected  works of T.S. Elliot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to talk about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda looks over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "We are the hollow men, the stuffed  men, headpieces filled with straw."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny, huh? I've become a literal  metaphor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the books down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to fight you. I just want  what's best for the program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. And you being right doesn't  make it any easier for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can be scared. That's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not scared of being stuck this  way. With a little more make-up and  practice, I could... (he motions to his face) ... pass. Y'know, get by in the world.  But the testing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're talking like you've given up.  It's only been a few months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it's years? I don't know how  much more testing I can take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian paces back and forth, glancing at the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda, Matt and Sebastian, in latex and scrubs, stare at  an electron microscope's video display. On the screen in  a sparse colony of blood calls but every second more and  more cells appear, filling the gap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others in the lab listen. They start to get excited.  Janice and Carter leave their research and come over to  watch the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got it. We've got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wait. Linda points to a blank patch on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all we need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, baby. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the blood cells nearest the blank patch twinkle out  existence, and then those around them also blink away  until after a beat, the screen is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full quantum cascade at 95%. (beat) I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sorry? You're fucking sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian picks up a glass beaker and hurls it against  the wall. It shatters. SEBASTIAN (cont'd) Six weeks of this shit and you're  sorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs more equipment and begins tossing it in a rage.  Carter and Janice grab him and restrain him. After  struggling against them a beat or two, Sebastian calms  down and pushes away from them and heads out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't blame him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him alone. He just needs to blow  off some steam.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Sebastian lies in his bed, staring at the security  camera. The camera stares back at him. As if from a dream, we hear the Brunette's muffled scream and cries for help. As we push in on Sebastian's cold  eyes, we can barely make out her face thrashing back in  forth in panic and confusion. Sebastian suddenly rises. He crosses to the video camera and examines a small panel on the underneath of the camera. He reaches into a box of twinkies and pulls out one of  the sponge cakes and begins munching. He hits the  intercom button on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to the lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waste of time. Da Vinci never slept.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank eyes Sebastian in the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'm here if you need me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches as Sebastian's heat signature moves toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dark deserted lab, Sebastian pulls together a  circuit board, a computer chip and some wiring. He seems be assembling something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian crosses underneath the camera... just out of  its range... reaches up and using a screwdriver, unscrews the access panel. He scans the electronics and attaches  two alligator clips to wires on the circuit board. Trailing a long length of wire, Sebastian crosses back to his bed and lies down. He holds a black project box with  a button on it. He lies perfectly still and press the  button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The video image of the Recovery Chamber flickers  slightly, before returning to normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian rises and begins to peel off his latex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian's POV - Various animals stir restlessly. A DOG, visible, leaps against the Plexiglas, barking wildly. We  push further down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, Sebastian's POV as he pushes through the open door of the observation room. We see Frank sorting through  various computer readouts, highlighting certain coding  sequences. We push in until we are looking over Frank's shoulder at  the video monitor. According to the video, Sebastian is  sleeping soundly in his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rewired security camera stares down at the empty bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank glances over at the video monitor. He can see  Sebastian's heat signature lying in the bed. Frank feels something on his neck. He flicks whatever it  is away with his hand and goes back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator door opens. The Guard turns around. The  elevator is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Metro Subway train draws to a halt. With a cautionary  "BING BONG" its doors slide open. A handful of people  exit and enter. One man bumps shoulders. He turns round  to apologize, but there's no one there. The doors close  and the train pulls out of the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of pretty girls exit a bar and stumble to their  apartments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the girls enters her apartment. The door half  closes behind her and then reopens and closes again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's reading a book when Linda and Matt enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet. He worked in the lab till about  10:30 and then went to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on the security camera. The wires have been removed and the access panel replaced. Sebastian whistles a cheerful tune as he finishes  applying his makeup. The door opens and Linda and Matt  enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, my two favorite people. Good  morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why so cheery this morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know some days you just wake up  feeling the world is full of  potential. Like your eyes have been  opened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm happy if I make it to my coffee  machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda hands Sebastian a disk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I restructured the third genome on  your radiated protein strand. Thought  you might want to take look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cook up a batch and let's see where we  go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd want to take a look at  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trust you. Now if you'll excuse me,  I need to have my head examined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda pulls bags of frozen plasma from the shelves in the walk-in storage freezer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, I know him.  Something's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think he knows about us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he knew about us, he'd be angry and  that wasn't angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janice heads up one of the corridors when something on  the floor catches her eye. She bends down and takes a  look at it. Barely visible on the floor is a fragment of  a BAREFOOT FOOTPRINT. She runs her finger along the dried mud. It turns to  dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian holds his latex head on his lap, while EEG  leads hang suspended in mid-air, outlining his real head. Carter analyzes the results.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you were a kid, you ever dream  about being invisible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure... all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you imagine you'd do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The usual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the usual?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanging out in the girl's locker room.  Kicking Jimmy Margiani's ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy Margiani?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: School asshole. Drove a red Trans Am.  Back then, I was the size of a small  planet and made a rather large target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever think up anything along the grand  scale?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. World domination. Manipulating  stock markets, consolidating a  political power base. But those are  more recent fantasies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter pulls off the electrodes and Sebastian slides on  his latex facemask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what if it weren't fantasy? What  if you were out there in the world and  could do whatever you wanted with no  consequences whatsoever. How far would  go? I mean... if it were real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, man. Out in the real  world... I mean, there's a  responsibility...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's say you saw a woman with amazing  tits. Would you brush against them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, I try and do that now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Human nature. So if you could get away  with more, would you do more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read that in a survey at a major  university they asked college students  "Would you steal if you were  guaranteed to get away with it?" 82%  said yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighty two percent? Makes you wonder  if the world's ready for what we're  doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Doc what did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you were out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just walked around. Y'know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, you just walked around? Come on.  There's more, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I'd be walking up to people  saying shit like "This is God, go,get  a haircut." Or hanging out in the  changing room at Victoria's Secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of sophomoric, don't you think.  Besides, it was late and I wasn't out  that long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, did you see anybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was this one girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? And did you mess with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian gives Carter a sly grin. SEBASTIAN (cont'd) Well maybe a little. (beat) I tell you though, a man could get  used to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone, Linda packs up her stuff for the evening. Slowly we push in on her and hear quiet breathing. We  realize we are in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda-jumps. SEBASTIAN'S VOICE (cont'd) Sorry, didn't mean to frighten you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine. I just didn't know you were  there. Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she leaves the Lab, he follows her down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda passes through the revolving doors of her apartment building. A few beats later, as if caught by a gust of  wind, the revolving door slowly turns on its own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda slips into her apartment and the door closes behind her. A moment later we see the doorknob turn back and  forth. It's locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a fire escape, we see the ladder shake and descend to  the ground. The metal rattles back and forth as if  something were climbing it. We slowly crane up the fire escape and hold on a window.  Through the wispy curtains and dirty glass we can see  Linda enter the room. The panel of glass fogs from  Sebastian's breath. The fog wipes away, seemingly by  itself. But then through the window we see Matt walk into the  living room and put his arms around Linda's waist. We  hear a shocked intake of air. He kisses her neck and then slowly unzips her dress. Her  dress falls to the floor. Matt takes off his sport coat  and drapes it over a chair, while Linda unfastens the  buttons of his shirt. They're laughing now, exchanging  kisses. Matt reaches behind Linda and unhooks her bra. He kisses  his way down her neck to her breasts. Linda pulls him to  her. Suddenly the window shatters. Startled, both Matt and  Linda jump back covering themselves. We hear Sebastian's footsteps as he retreats down the  fire escape. A moment later Matt reaches the window and peers out. He  sees the fire escape ladder slowly rise back up down  below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I don't see anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt picks up a piece of glass and examines it. MATT (cont'd) It's like something hit it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda picks up the phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter looks at the security monitor of the recovery  room. Sebastian's heat signature lies still on the bed. CARTER (cont'd) No. No. He's here No, I'm staring at  him. He's right there in his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda breathes a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. No, just checking. 'Kay, bye. (hangs up phone) Phew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt pulls her into him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax... it's nothing. Where were we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARKING can be heard in the background. That horrible  repetitive barking that grates the soul like Chinese  water torture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be quiet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A photograph of Linda drifts through the air and settles  atop a flaming candle. It ignites into fire, twisting and turning in mid-air, then falling on the floor as ash. A  beat later water runs from the sink faucet. It forms in  the shape of hands and splashes against his face,  dripping away. SEBASTIAN'S VOICE (cont'd) And the cyclops screamed out, "Who is  it who blinds me?" and Odysseus  replied "Nobody is my name". And the  Cyclops raged to his friends "Nobody  is killing me. Nobody".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The barking continues. A moment later the chamber door  slides open. We push down the...

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY OF THE HABITATS
dialogues.text: ... until we are face-to-face with the unhappy barking  dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh. It's Nobody-It's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Plexiglas door to the doggie's cage swings open and  some invisible force grabs little doggie around the neck. The force squeezes its little fur ball throat until the  barking stops. SEBASTIAN'S VOICE (cont'd) Nobody's gonna hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The force keeps squeezing until the little doggie goes  limp. Then the dog smashes against the Plexiglas over and over until blood spills out its mouth. The Plexiglas door swings closed again and moments later the door to  Sebastian's cubicle closes as well. The water runs in  Sebastian's sink washing the blood away from his now half visible hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah sees the dead dog lying prone on its bedding. She  eyes it curiously and opens the cage door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah stares at the empty chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You awake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sheets raise and drape off of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Notice anything unusual last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Franklin Three. He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian pulls a sheet around him. He moves across the  dimly lit room like a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His neck was broken and his windpipe  collapsed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd that happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought maybe you could tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah... You saying I had something to  do with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was alive last night when I left  and he was dead this morning. And you  were the only one down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in my room all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah sits with Carter as they run through the security  video tape. Matt and Linda look over their shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all twelve hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He never left the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A windpipe doesn't just suddenly  collapse. Someone or something killed  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw the tape. The man was in his  chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we have a problem, because I the  cage was locked from the outside. That  means it was opened, the dog was  killed and the cage was closed and  locked again. Only a human could do  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it wasn't me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it wasn't him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda passes Sebastian's chamber. Sebastian's in latex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any big plans for tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet night at home. Maybe a book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Whatever happened to that guy  your were seeing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still in the picture. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being locked down here, I'm forced to  live vicariously. Someday you'll have  to tell me what he's like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe someday I will. See you in the  morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Au domain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian watches Linda walk away. He glances at the  camera and starts to peel off his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator door opens. It's empty. SEBASTIAN'S POV - as we push past the guard and down onto the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty street. We hear whistling. Splashes of water splat  out from shallow puddles,,as Sebastian walks through  them. SEBASTIAN'S POV - A car approaches. As it drives by we  see Matt and Linda inside, heading back to the warehouse. The footsteps stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the footsteps start to head back toward the  warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda and Matt exit their car and cross toward the  elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Marine Guard) Forgot something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we watch the footsteps head back through the puddles  toward the warehouse, we see Frank pass us in his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He breaks into a run. Feet splash water and he races back toward the warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty. The elevator door opens and we push out into the  hallway. Sebastian's POV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow Sebastian down the hallway to his cubicle. But  as he rounds the corner, he quickly ducks back. The  entire research team is in his cubicle. Sebastian slowly  approaches and watches as Frank takes down his video  board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty clever really. All it does is  recycle the signal. He flips this  switch, it takes a snapshot and that's  all we see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you think he's violent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed a dog with his bare hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dogs aren't people. Are we in any  danger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda doesn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either way, we aren't equipped to  handle this. We have to inform the  committee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody murmurs in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he doesn't come back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll go after him. (beat) Who has tonight's shift?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretend nothing's wrong. Everyone just  do what you're doing so he doesn't  become suspicious. Okay? Matt and I'll  go tell Doctor Kramer and we'll lot  the committee deal with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian's POV - He backs away and races down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stately stone house sits on a finely manicured lawn  in one of the nicest neighborhoods in town. Linda's car  is parked on the curb in front. We break from a typical establishing shot and as the  CAMERA tracks closer to the house, we realize that we are

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear breathing and footsteps as we push through some  bushes and head toward a bay window which looks into the  Kramer living room. Through the glass we see LINDA and MATT seated across  from DR. KRAMER. We can't hear what they're saying but it certainly looks serious. Kramer puffs on a pipe and  strokes his beard, shaking his head. Kramer rises and shakes hands with Linda and Matt, and  the three of them head toward the front door. We move away from the window and track toward the front  door. As the door opens we begin to hear the tail end of  the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call General Caster right now and  convene the oversight committee  tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do in the meantime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just sit tight and wait for my call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt and Linda head down to her car. Kramer heads back  inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kramer heads back into the living room. His wife appears  a the upstairs railing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a little trouble at work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You coming up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a minute. I have to make a few  calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Kramer retreats back to her bedroom as Dr. Kramer  crosses over to the telephone. He picks up the receiver  and starts dialing. In the middle of dialing, the phone  goes dead. He clicks the hookswitch up and down trying to get a dial tone. Nothing. He checks the connections on  the phone and then follows the wiring to the wall. The  line's plugged in. Weird. He hears a door creak open in  the kitchen. KRAMER (cont'd) Hello? Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kramer crosses to the darkened kitchen. The kitchen door  leading to the backyard is open. Puzzled, he crosses to  it. A wind stirs across the pool and backyard, swirling  dead leaves in small twists of wind. The windchime rings  lightly. Kramer steps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dim spillover light from house, Kramer crosses to  the telephone- box against the back of the house. It Is  open and several of the wires have been pulled. He looks  around, spooked and puffs out a cloud of smoke from his  pipe. For the briefest of instants, Sebastian's face is  visible in the smoke. Kramer jumps back in surprise and  the pipe drops from his mouth. He gives a small sharp  cry, but deep indentations appear across his mouth and  his cries are stifled. In the darkness, we can make out  his form writhing as if possessed. The struggle continues a beat until Kramer manages to break free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help! HELP! MARTHA! HELP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kramer runs, he looks behind him. But no one's there.  WHAM! Something slams into Kramer and he tumbles, rolling into the pool. But as he hits water there's not just one  splash, but TWO. In the water next to him is human shaped AIR-POCKET. It's Sebastian displacing the water. And  because of the water displacement, we can clearly see two arms pushing Kramer beneath the water's surface.  MARTHA KRAMER opens the bedroom window and looks down at  the pool. All she can see is her husband drowning... his  flailing limbs kicking up a massive air bubble around  him. She races from the window. Kramer kicks and flails  for a few moments and then his limbs stop moving. A  moment later he floats to surface, face down. The AIR  POCKET bobs over to the pool ladder, and rising from the  pool, we see Sebastian's body outlined in sheets of  water. The shape melts away in a cascading waterfall  until all we can see of Sebastian are the hundreds of  tiny droplets still clinging to his body, caught in the  light like twinkling bulbs on a Christmas tree. The shape disappears into the darkness. A moment later Martha  emerges from the house and sees her husband floating face down in the pool. She screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda passes by Sebastian's chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No good morning for me? Don't  you like me anymore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry. I...I'm in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay. It's going to be busy  day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt sits across from her, twirling a pen in his hand.  They both stare at the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did he say held call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's probably meeting with the  committee trying to figure out what to  do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna call him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda picks up the phone and dials. LINDA (cont'd) Yes, Dr. Kramer please. Excuse me? (inhales sharply - surprised) When? I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda blanches as she hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead. Drowned in his pool last  night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda picks up the phone again and dials. LINDA (cont'd) Yes, General Thompson please. Thank  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she waits the phone line clicks dead. LINDA (cont'd) Hello? Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She clicks on the hookswitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries it too. Same result. MATT (cont'd) Intercom's working, but there doesn't  seem to be an outside line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They waste no time getting to the elevator. Linda and  Matt step in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back with help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda taps in his floor code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Authorization please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foster One Delta Eight Three Five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Authorization invalid. Request denied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda taps the keypad again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Authorization please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foster One Delta Eight Three Five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Authorization invalid. Request denied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me try mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt hits buttons on the keypad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Authorization please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kensington Two Romeo One Five Nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Authorization invalid. Request denied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me this isn't happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, Sarah, Carter and Janice man various work stations in the lab. Linda and Matt enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's fingers fly over the keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long before anybody starts looking  for us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no set check in procedure. It  could be weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A graphic of the elevator system pops up on the screen.  Frank highlights the security terminal. Frank hits a few  more keys. The screen reduces to a series of numbers. LINDA (cont'd) You think you can got in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank rewrites a few of the numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Already in. It was only a second level  encryption.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Security System specifications pops up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some security system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh the system is fine. It's just I'm  just extraordinary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank types a few more keys, and his eyes widen. FRANK (cont'd) But apparently someone is more  extraordinary than me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing wrong with the system.  Our codes have been removed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Removed? By who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's a clue. Only one code remains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Sebastian Caine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team approaches Sebastian's chamber. Carter pulls on  the pair of thermal goggles dangling from his neck up. THERMAL POV - The chamber is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda enters the chamber. She notes that Sebastian's face and makeup are on the sink vanity. Linda crosses to the  phone and hits the "PAGE BUTTON"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Sebastian. Fun's over. Tell us  where you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She waits. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. But I can't lot you turn me  in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian... where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea what it's like. The  power of it. The freedom. I can't let  that go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Sebastian. You're scaring me.  Tell me where you are and we can talk  about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to talk about. See ...  I've done things that can't be undone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beep as the intercom clicks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian! Sebastian! (beat) I want search parties. Thermal goggles  and tranquilizers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda and Matt, wearing thermal goggles and clutching  tranquilizer pistols, walk down the hallway, scanning  back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janice enters the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Caine? Are you in here? Dr. Caine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Janice jerks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah scans all the habitats with a thermal scanner.  Listening intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janice struggles with her unseen assailant, slamming into walls and knocking into filing cabinets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Carter search the lab with their thermal  scopes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Caine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda and Matt knock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response. They push through the door. The room seems  deserted. Signs of a struggle. File cabinets opened,  drawers tossed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THERMAL POV - Linda surveys the room, spotting a slight  heat signature peeking from the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda moves toward it. Whatever it is its hidden from  Matt's POV by the supply cabinet. As Linda gets close she pulls of f her thermal goggles to see...

dialogues.speaker: JANICE -
dialogues.text: Her face blue, eyes bulging. An I.V. cord wrapped around  his neck. Linda jumps back. LINDA (cont'd) Jesus. Oh my god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt rushes over. Sees the lifeless corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda lowers the body to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was strangled. Multiple blows to  her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda begins a medical check of the rest of the body.  Matt stoops down and examines Janice's face. LINDA (cont'd) We got a big problem here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lamp tumbles from the desk and smashes to the floor.  Both Linda and Matt jump. Linda frantically dons the  thermal visor and scopes the room again. Nothing. Matt  notices the lamp cord beneath Linda's leg. Points it out  to her. She sighs with relief... she pulled the lamp off  the table. LINDA (cont'd) Get everybody to the conference room.  Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt picks up the phone. Clicks the hookswitch. Clicks  the hookswitch again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intercom... the phone lines. They're  dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She checks the phone, punches some numbers. Nothing. LINDA (cont'd) It was just working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt and Linda head toward the lab. Linda suddenly stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda takes a few cautious steps. Senses something. LINDA (cont'd) Give me the visor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt, suddenly concerned, hands her the visor.  THERMAL POV - Linda checks out the corridor. Empty. Linda takes Matt's hand. LINDA (cont'd) C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move quickly up the corridor. See Frank, Sarah and  Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you find him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janice is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda scans the room with her thermal scope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt, Frank, Janice and Sarah step in, locking the door  behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man has checked out of reality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it obvious? Right now, we're the  only ones who knows he exists. If he  gets rid of us, no one knows and he  becomes the most powerful man on  earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's not a killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look at Linda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wasn't. He is now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you fix the elevator? Restore our  codes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'd take hours to crack the  encryptions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now that sounds like good news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do we do until then. Sit  around waiting for him to kill us off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks around for some leadership. Finally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We find him, before he finds us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group moves quickly, passing under an air vent. As  they round the corner the vent slowly swings down and an  air disturbance drops to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they enter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure this'll work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda sits down at a computer terminal, activates it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We designed it to help find the rats  we kept dropping in year one. They  were too small for thermal scans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A map of the compound appears on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Systems hot. Activating motion  detectors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt toggles a switch. Linda stares at a map of the  compound. Blips appear on the display... in the  observation room... in the Habitat Area and in one of the corridors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got movement in Corridor Six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shadow edges down the tunnel. It settles for a moment,  disappearing completely, then is back on the move. At the tunnel's edges, motion detectors light up as the thing  passes by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter checks his Tranq pistol & Matt rummages throug locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt pulls out a pair of walkie-talkies. He tosses one to Linda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into walkie) Check. Check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her voice echoes from the other unit. LINDA (cont'd) Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just watch our backs. Hey Carter,  ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt and Carter exit. Linda locks the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt and Carter trot toward corridor six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda huddles over the display, tracking the two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into Walkie) Take a right at the next accessway.  He's working his way back to the  offices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Matt and Carter on one of the working video  screens as they push down the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt and Carter move cautiously, listening for any sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Walkie - sotto) If we split up, can we trap him on  corridor eight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he keeps heading in that direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt nods to Carter. The pair splits, heading down  separate accessways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going Thermal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt pulls the visor down over his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda watches the two separate and come around Sebastian  in a pincer move. Suddenly, the blip that was Sebastian disappears. Linda  grabs the walkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lost him. Matt, I lost him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt makes his way forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He probably just stopped moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Matt becomes more cautious with his footsteps. Slowly ... approaching a corner... He rounds the corner and sees a heat signature at the far end of the corridor. He levels his pistol, ready to fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt pulls off his goggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did he get by us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He couldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian! We're here to help.  Sebastian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response. They both don their visors and move forward  slightly. Carter holds up his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. Behind those pipes. He's not  moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter points. Matt checks his thermal. A red heat  signature clings to the wall. CARTER (cont'd) Doctor Caine? (beat) Can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into walkie) We see him. But he's not responding.  The heat signature doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt looks through his visor and holds the tranquilizer  gun at the ready. He looks for a clear shot. The heat  signature huddles behind pipes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon... C'mon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two slowly move closer. Matt finally has a clear  shot. He signals Carter. Carter levels his pistol too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Covered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt fires the dart at the heat signature. It bounces off the wall ... Nothing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crosses to the heat signature. MATT (cont'd) Just a vent. Just a goddamn vent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like... looks like we're pumping  out heat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly behind him... CARTER JERKS THREE FEET in the  air, kicking wildly. SUSPENDED IN MID-AIR BY HIS NECK. He gasps for air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got movement again! He's right on  top of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fucking shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt opens fire with the tranquilize, shooting at the  ceiling until he spends his dart rounds. MATT (cont'd) Sebastian? Goddamnit! Let him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (choking) H...Help... MMmmphg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter suffocates. He passes out. With a sudden crack,  he's thrown against the side wall. A large cut opens up  across his head and his body goes limp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into walkie) Where is he? Where the fuck is he?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda huddles over the display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right on top of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt scrambles away. Running. Pipes burst and swing down  from the ceiling. Steam billows forth. Something moves  through the cloud of steam. Around the corner, Matt shoves more darts into his  tranquilizer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on? Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter's down. Hurt bad. Bleeding from  a head wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda watches the screen. Two blips, one traveling  quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt, he's coming toward you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt takes a few steps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got outta there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt breaks into a run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda watches one dot chasing the other, down several  corridors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's close!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt running, checking over his shoulder. Sounds of  footsteps behind him, but up ahead the heavy metal blast  doors begin to close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit. The doors are closing. He's  shutting me in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt rushes the doors as they slide shut. He doesn't make it in time. The doors close with a resounding clang. Matt turns and pulls on his thermals. MATT (cont'd) Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda huddled over the screen. Tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's coming right at you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then checks the Thermal goggles. Several heat signature  dot the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty, maybe thirty feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit, I got thermals all over the  place. Eight, maybe ten of them. Must  be ghosts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda gets a sense of forboding. She looks around the  room. Sees a heating vent in the corner. Beat. She grabs the walkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those signatures ... they're coming  from the heating vents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the goggles, Matt sees the tunnel turning red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm starting to lose resolution on my  thermals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the room temperature is the same as  his body temperature, thermal  visors'll be no good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda grabs a Tranq gun and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda...it's not safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I'm going. (to Frank and Sarah) Corridor eight is clear. Get Carter to  the lab. We'll meet you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt turns to face the corridor. It's turning red. Matt  sees some movement in the thermal cloud. Opens fire. But  the thermal signature disappears into the heat. Matt  can't distinguish anything through his goggles anymore.  He pulls them off and holds him gun in front of him  sweeping the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco...Polo... Marco... Polo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice keeps shifting. Matt fires. SEBASTIAN'S VOICE (cont'd) Not even close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt sweeps his front leg back and forth, like a blind  man using a cane. But his foot isn't hitting anything. He sees a FIRE EXTINGUISHER mounted on the wall. He rushes  it, turns it on the hallway and sprays. And SOMETHING  LUNGES through the foam. GRABS HIM, sending him tumbling  down the tunnel. Matt is thrown against the wall. Blood  coming from his brow. He scrambles away, spraying more  foam. Sees a shape in the mist, raises his pistol and  FIRES. The shape leaps away. The DART FLIES. Doesn't hit. Matt scrambles back into a corner. His pistol is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... just out of curiosity, how long  has my best friend been fucking my ex- girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian. Get a hold of yourself. You  aren't thinking rationally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a pretty sweet fuck, isn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, Sebastian... we can talk  this through. It's not too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shape parts the low hanging mist, the fine powder  swirling in clouds behind it. Coming toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Sebastian. Don't do this. I'm  your friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but I just feel that our  friendship is holding me back. I'm  sure you understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DOOR OPENS. Linda reaches through, grabs Matt. She  pulls him to his feet and through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Sarah, holding their Tranq pistols, fly down  the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shear off the main corridor into the side corridor.  Carter lies crumpled up ahead. Sarah slides to his side.  Carter's head rests in a pool of blood. She checks his  pulse while Frank takes a protective position. SARAH (cont'd) Pulse is weak. Breathing... shallow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pretty severe. We have to get him  to the lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got to be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stands frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For godsakes, help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank snaps to. Grabs an arm. The pair hoist Carter up  and carry him down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda pulls a handle and doors slide shut behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was going to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda pulls him close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to got out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda checks the screen -- see Sarah, Frank and Carter  headed toward the Laboratory. MATT (cont'd) Where is he? Goddamnit, where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isolated in the Hallway of Habitats is a single blip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Habitats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god. That's right between us and  the lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Sarah lift Carter onto a medical table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His pulse is faint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah grabs a sheet from the counter top. Folds it and  presses it against the head wound. SARAH (cont'd) He's lost a lot of blood. Here. Hold  this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She guides Frank's hands to the wound. SARAH (cont'd) Keep applying pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah pulls out a saline solution I.V. bag and slap it on the rack. She fumbles with the needle as she tries to  find a vein. SARAH (cont'd) Don't move your hand until I got back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah heads to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This'll hold him but he needs blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Supply is right down the hall. I'll be  two seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah, wait for the others

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I wait, he'll die. Keep pressure on  the wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah exits the lab. Checks the corridor. Down at the end of the cramped tunnel is the supply room. She swallows her fear and heads toward it, all the while  glancing side-to-side and behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooked, Sarah bursts into the room. She goes to the  supply fridge/freezer, pulls open the door, and sorts  through blood bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt and Linda push along the corridor; Matt spraying  with the fire extinguisher in short controlled bursts,  Linda clutching her tranquilizer like a commando. A noise behind them. Footsteps. Matt turns to blast with the extinguisher. The white  chemical dust sprays out, outlining a shape in the  tunnel. But it isn't a human shape. Matt's uniform shreds. Something with fierce sharp claws  fells him. Tearing into his flesh. We see a angry, hungry face... jabbing for a moment through the lingering fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh!  Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda tries to get a clear shot off through the smoke.  Matt trips and goes sprawling. Something yelps. A howl.  Linda shoots. Her dart jabs into something which  collapses to the ground. A moment of calm. As the dusty  chemical foam settles, the outline of a great ape  appears, still twitching. MATT (cont'd) Karl Three. Nice shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's let the animals out. It wasn't  him we were tracking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda leans against the wall, still clutching her tranq  gun at the ready. The heat is getting to bar. Bar scrubs  are soaked, her hair's a mess. She wipes the sweat from  her brow. LINDA (cont'd) You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't kill me unless it gets  infected. You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me .... Don't ask about me. If he  freed all the animals, we could have  dozens running around the lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he could be anywhere right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt sprays the whole tunnel, putting down a gentle cloud mist. Nothing else appears. MATT (cont'd) What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get to the lab, lock the goddamn doors  and pray to God Frank can reprogram  the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah finishes collecting blood bags and shuts the door  to the fridge/freezer. The DOOR SLAMS behind her. She freezes and slowly turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She eyes the supply room, looking for a sign of movement. SARAH (cont'd) (frightened whisper) Who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She listens. Is that breathing she hears? Now she's  starting to panic. SARAH (cont'd) Dr. Caine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to back away, but she's already in the corner. She clutches her tranquilizer gun, but there's nothing to aim at. The vials of blood on the shelf gives her an  idea. She reaches over, grabs a vial and throws it on the floor. GLASS SHATTERS and BLOOD SMEARS across the  linoleum. Sarah tosses another vial and another. Becoming more and more hysterical. Splattering more and more  blood. But she runs out of vials. Shaking with fear, she  searches the blood looking for a footprint, or movement.  But there's nothing there. Sarah waits a beat, clutching  the tranquilizer gun. Takes a step. Waits a beat longer. Finally she relaxes. It was just her imagination. She  heads toward the door when she hears a terrifying whisper in her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You missed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her hair flies up, and she swings against the wall. She  tries to move, but she's pinned there. Her hands  struggling against the force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please no. Let me go. Oh god, let me  go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The arm holding the tranquilizer gun begins to move. SARAH (cont'd) What are you doing? No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah fights, but her arm moves nonetheless SARAH (cont'd) Help me! Oh God. Somebody help me! FRANK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, deliberately, her own arm moves down the wall and around, until the tranquilizer gun points right at her  stomach. Sarah watches in horror as her own body betrays her. SARAH (cont'd) No... please. Don't do this to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She struggles, shaking back and forth. Writhing. In  anguish and in fear. SARAH (cont'd) What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trigger pulls .... Pop! A dart explodes from the gun and imbeds in Sarah's  stomach. She whimpers as her eyes glass over. Suddenly  she's released. She stumbles backward and falls lifeless  to the floor. A moment of stillness, all we can hear is  the sound of someone breathing. On Sarah's face... a slight-indentation runs down her  cheek.. Almost sweet... almost tender. And slight indentation  runs across her breast and strokes down her body. The  sense of violation and vulnerability is awful. Sebastian  sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always liked your feistiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah's head shifts slightly. Her head shifts violently,  accompanied by the celery crunch of her neck snapping.  Sebastian exhales, his breath filled with the  intoxication of power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank applies pressure to the wound, waiting for Sarah to return. Carter's vital signs are weakening..,.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah! Sarah! (to Carter) Goddamnit. Stay with me now. Don't you  let up... Sarah! Sarah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response. Frank doesn't know whether to stay or go  after her. He starts toward the door several times but  can't leave Carter. Finally the door opens. FRANK (cont'd) Sarah! I'm losing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
